main event: A UFO was observed in Pelham, Georgia on April 6, 1958, moving very slowly toward the West for approximately 90 minutes. The object was described as being the size of a baseball and appeared to be made of metal.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 90 minutes, allowing for a detailed study of the object.
The object was described as being the size of a baseball and made of metal, characteristics not typically associated with conventional aircraft.
The object moved very slowly toward the West, exhibiting unusual behavior for known aircraft or natural phenomena.
The conclusion of the report indicated that while the description was characteristic of a balloon, it could not be explained as such due to inconsistencies.
The observation was made by a civilian in Pelham, Georgia, with the weather conditions being unlimited visibility and calm winds.
photographs: no photographs included in the report
